job.title: Deep Learning Analytics – Senior Advanced Data Scientist / Software Engineer (REMOTE)
job.industry: Information Technology and Services,Defense & Space,Computer Software
job.description:
General Dynamics Mission Systems (GDMS) engineers a diverse portfolio of high technology solutions, products and services that enable customers to successfully execute missions across all domains of operation.&nbsp; With a global team of 13,000+ top professionals, we partner with the best in industry to expand the bounds of innovation in the defense and scientific arenas.&nbsp; Given the nature of our work and who we are, we value trust, honesty, alignment and transparency.&nbsp; We offer highly competitive benefits and pride ourselves in being a great place to work with a shared sense of purpose. &nbsp;You will also enjoy a flexible work environment where contributions are recognized and rewarded.&nbsp; If who we are and what we do resonates with you, we invite you to join our high performance team!&nbsp;General Dynamics is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer that is committed to hiring a diverse and talented workforce.&nbsp; EOE/Disability/Veteran      &nbsp;      &nbsp;      Basic Qualifications:&nbsp; Bachelor&rsquo;s of Science or Arts in a STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics) related field plus 8 yrs or Master&rsquo;s degree plus 6 yrs.      &nbsp;      &nbsp;      Clearance Requirements:   Ability to obtain a Department of Defense Top Secret security clearance is required at time of hire. Department of Defense Top Secret security clearance is preferred. Applicants selected will be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Due to the nature of work performed within our facilities, U.S. citizenship is required.      &nbsp;      &nbsp;      &nbsp;      Deep Learning Analytics Center of Excellence (DLACoE) is looking for a seasoned, experienced professional having a wide range of data integration, data visualization, big data and programming skills, possessing a demonstrated understanding of artificial intelligence or machine learning with the ability to apply these skills under real world conditions.      &nbsp;      Duties and Tasks:&nbsp;        - Lead the design and development of machine learning algorithms to support and achieve customer goals   - Accountable for the direction and completion of a project   
  - Perform program management duties&nbsp;   
  - Draw on expertise and research to apply data science and machine learning to challenging problems over a broad range of domains&nbsp;   
  - Direct and collaborate with a dispersed and diverse team of engineers and scientists to implement data driven solutions   
  - Represent DLA CoE as a subject matter expert (SME) across the organization and with senior leaders    
   
  - Assignments vary by task and may require you to:  - Wrangle, preprocess and manipulate data for use in machine learning algorithms   
  - Develop a proficiency with deep learning algorithms, design considerations, and methods to overcome limitations or constraints due to hardware or data   
  - Plan and conduct experiments to improve model performance   
  - Export deep architectures onto a small SWAP hardware platform (such as an FPGA or GPU SoC systems)   
  - Optimize deep architectures for performance, and implement systems to formalize and support such optimization   
  - Communicate results to team members and external non-technical leadership   
   
  - Provide mentoring and training to team members   
  - Collaborate with customer/domain experts through research and development   
  - Contribute to technical proposals and business development   
  - Present new concepts clearly through oral and visual media   
  - Excellent written and verbal communications skills   
&nbsp;Technical Skills:        - Machine learning and deep learning in Python and CUDA (including scikit-learn, TensorFlow, Caffe / Caffe2, PyTorch, etc.)    
  - DevOps, including machine provisioning (e.g. Vagrant, Puppet, Docker)    
  - Familiarity with the Linux command line (bash scripting)   
  - Experience working with large, complex datasets (images, cyber, NLP, and other signals)    
  - Distributed version control systems (e.g. git)   
  - Data preparation and corpus filtering (with PostgresSQL, mySQL, and other DBs)    
  - Validation methods   
  - Experimental design   
&nbsp;      &nbsp;      #CJ3
